title: Farnham Farm
text:
The Farnham Farm is historic farm at 113 Mount Pleasant Avenue on <a href="Prudence%20Island">Prudence Island</a> in <a href="Portsmouth%2C%20Rhode%20Island">Portsmouth, Rhode Island</a>.
The farm was started by the Dennis family after the original farms on Prudence Island were burned and destroyed by the British during the <a href="American%20Revolution">American Revolution</a> around the time of the <a href="Battle%20of%20Rhode%20Island">Battle of Rhode Island</a>. The farm contains several extant structures including a <a href="house">house</a> (ca. 1805), <a href="barn">barn</a> (ca. 1850), <a href="milking">milk house</a>, <a href="field%20%28agriculture%29">field</a>s, <a href="garden">garden</a>, <a href="woodland">woodland</a>, <a href="orchard">orchard</a>, and stone walls. The Dennis family sold the house to the Farnhams in 1867. The site was added to the <a href="National%20Register%20of%20Historic%20Places">National Register of Historic Places</a> in 2006.
The farm is now owned by the Prudence Conservancy, a local preservation organization.
